channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Black Friday faces its ultimate test as desperate retailers and low consumer confidence collide in a high-stakes holiday standoff
item.description: "Consumers feel on edge," says Mastercard chief economist Michelle Meyer.

item.title: Andriy Yermak, Zelensky’s Chief of Staff, Resigns
item.description: Andriy Yermak, President Volodymyr Zelensky’s chief of staff and top peace negotiator, became the highest-ranking casualty of an investigation into a ...

item.title: Trump says he wants to ‘permanently pause migration’ from poor countries: ‘Only reverse migration can fully cure this situation’
item.description: Donald Trump spent part of his Thanksgiving holiday railing against immigrants on social media.

item.title: Israeli Raid in Southern Syria Kills at Least 13, Syrian Officials Say
item.description: The raid appeared to be one of Israel’s deadliest cross-border incursions since Bashar al-Assad, Syria’s former dictator, was ousted last year.

item.title: U.S. stocks lift on the last day of November as Wall Street eagerly awaits the results of Black Friday
item.description: Wall Street is operating on an abbreviated schedule Friday after being closed for the Thanksgiving holiday.

item.title: Winter Storm in Northern U.S. Expected to Snarl Post-Thanksgiving Travel
item.description: Forecasters say a winter storm could disrupt travel, bringing up to two feet of snow across parts of the Midwest through the holiday weekend.

item.title: The Louvre will hike prices for everyone who isn’t from Europe—from $25 to $37
item.description: Last year, the Louvre welcomed 8.7 millions visitors. 77% of them were foreigners.

item.title: Trump Uses National Guard Shooting to Cast Suspicion on Refugees
item.description: President Trump claimed there were “a lot of problems with Afghans,” without providing evidence, as his administration announced that it was implement...

item.title: Billionaire MacKenzie Scott once needed her college roommate’s help with a $1,000 loan: ‘That’s just what you do for friends’
item.description: Years later, Scott repaid the favor when Jeannie Tarkenton started Funding U, a lending company that offers merit-based loans to low-income students.

item.title: National Guard Soldier Dies After Being Shot in Washington
item.description: Another Guard member was in critical condition. The suspect is an Afghan man who once served in a paramilitary unit that worked with U.S. forces, offi...

item.title: Israeli Forces Kill Two Palestinians in West Bank After They Appear to Surrender, Video Shows
item.description: The Israeli authorities said they were investigating the shooting, which came amid days of extensive military operations in the West Bank.

item.title: Death Toll Rises to 128 in Hong Kong High-Rise Fire
item.description: Hope of finding survivors has dwindled, with many residents of the Wang Fuk Court towers still unaccounted for. Eight more people were arrested Friday...

item.title: Louvre Raising Ticket Prices for Non-European Visitors
item.description: From Jan. 14, visitors to the museum from outside the European Economic Area will pay 45 percent more for entry to help finance its ambitious renovati...

item.title: Israeli Raid in Southern Syria Kills at Least 13, Syrian Officials Say
item.description: The raid appeared to be one of Israel’s deadliest cross-border incursions since Bashar al-Assad, Syria’s former dictator, was ousted last year.

item.title: Andriy Yermak, Zelensky’s Chief of Staff, Resigns
